            Bio
            Juan C. Sanchez-Arias(he/him) is a medical
            doctor and neuroscientist working as the Team Lead
            of the Customer Therapeutics Data team at BenchSci where he uses
            his experience in medicine, neurobiology, biomedical
            research, and data analysis to magnify the impact of
            BenchSci’s platform on empowering preclinical scientists
            with the most advanced AI to increase the speed and quality
            of their research. Previously, he was a Postdoctoral Fellow
            in the Division of Medical Science at the University of
            Victoria funded by a Health Research BC Award (previously
            known as Michael Smith Health Research BC Award). Juan’s
            research experience includes investigating the cellular and
            molecular mechanisms underlying brain and heart development,
            neuronal network and synapse formation, and onset of
            inherited cardiac arrhythmias combining model organism
            experimentation, advanced microscopy, and computational
            biology. His other interests include data science,
            pathophysiological mechanisms of human disease, bio-image
            analysis automation, open science and data stweardship,
            generative artificial intelligence, and science
            communication.
            
            
            Experience
            BenchSci | Team Lead - Customer
            Therapeutics Data | Ocitber 2023 - present
            BenchSci | Science Tech Lead - Customer
            Therapeutics | July 2023 - October 2023
            BenchSci | Scientist II, Data Extraction
            | June 2022 - June 2023
            University of Victoria | Postdoctoral
            Fellow | August 2020 - June 2022
            Hospital Universitario del Valle ESE |
            Medical Intern | September 2013 - September 2014
            Centro de Estudios Cerebrales, Universidad del
            Valle | Research Intern | February 2014 - July
            2014
            
            
            Education
            University of Victoria | Victoria, BC,
            Canada
            Ph.D. in Neuroscience | January 2015 - April
            2020
            Universidad del Valle, School of
            Medicine | Cali, Valle, Colombia
            Doctor in Medicine | August 2007 - September
            2014

              Bio
              Juan C. Sanchez-Arias(he/him) is a medical
              doctor and neuroscientist working as the Team Lead
              of the Customer Therapeutics Data team at BenchSci where he
              uses his experience in medicine, neurobiology, biomedical
              research, and data analysis to magnify the impact of
              BenchSci’s platform on empowering preclinical scientists
              with the most advanced AI to increase the speed and
              quality of their research. Previously, he was a
              Postdoctoral Fellow in the Division of Medical Science at
              the University of Victoria funded by a Health Research BC
              Award (previously known as Michael Smith Health Research
              BC Award). Juan’s research experience includes
              investigating the cellular and molecular mechanisms
              underlying brain and heart development, neuronal network
              and synapse formation, and onset of inherited cardiac
              arrhythmias combining model organism experimentation,
              advanced microscopy, and computational biology. His other
              interests include data science, pathophysiological
              mechanisms of human disease, bio-image analysis
              automation, open science and data stweardship, generative
              artificial intelligence, and science communication.
